name: Mt. Coolidge Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We needed somewhere to stay so we could explore the White Mountains, what a gem. All rooms have the added bonus of being able to park a few feet away from your door. The rooms are very spacious and extremely clean, suffice to say this is the cleanest motel we have ever stayed in. The owners are so lovely and friendly and very helpful. Then there was the added bonus of the Pemigewassett River running along the back of the motel so that all rooms back onto this. It is situated in a lovely area close to some lovely villages and mountains.
reviews.title: What a gem

reviews.text: We did not have the pleasure of seeing a moose but if you look out of your window a couple of evenings a week the owners will oblige by running around in a moose outfit - worth a visit to see this... There is a super restaurant next door that looks out over the river and serves great breakfasts.
reviews.title: Wish I could give it 6 stars

reviews.text: The cleanliness and hominess of Mt. Coolidge Motel are second to none and exceeded only by the friendliness of the owners and the soothing beauty of the Pemigewassett River that runs behind the property. Our second stay—June 19-21—in room 11 was well worth the long drive from Virginia, and my father, who stayed in room 12, thoroughly enjoyed his first time in Lincoln and gives Mt. Coolidge and the Riley family the highest marks as well.
reviews.title: Like staying with family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Big and comfortable room. Extremely clean. No steps. Park the car 5 feet from the door. The BEST for people who need accessible accommodations. Nice guests - seem to be a lot of repeat customers. Sparkling clean. Very nice owner. Owner very accommodating. Easy to find - right off the highway. Great blueberry pancakes next door. The people at the restaurant said they recomend the Mt Coolidge too. We will ALWAYS stay here from now on.
reviews.title: Clean rooms, friendly hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed at Mt Coolidge Motel for a night but it was the cleanest motel/hotel we stayed in on our road trip. Everything was spotless. There are also some nice places near the river to sit and relax and there's fresh coffee in the morning. I myself always miss at least "a little bite" like a cookie or donut for breakfast but they said they'd offer coffee and coffee there was, so nothing to complain about :-) Plus, everything is within a short driving distance, supermarkets as well as attractions. We would definitely go back. Thank you, Vicky and Kevin! Christina & Ruben
reviews.title: No frills great place

reviews.text: Well maintained by the friendly and helpful owners. There is a great stream in back, and it is convenient to the Franconia Notch side of the mountains as well as to several good restaurants. I would stay there anytime I want to spend a few days in the White Mountains.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay in White Mountains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Mt. Coolidge Motel. We were very impressed with the cleanliness of property! The Riley Family takes care of you like you are part of their family. Their cat was even friendly! The pool was a nice bonus and was really clean too. Although the decor was from the 1970s it really fit and made it feel more homey. We will definitely be staying here again!
reviews.title: Nice Surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow - what am amazing place. Had the best stopover night here a few weeks ago. we were absolutely gutted to be leaving to head to Boston and will definitely be coming back to stay for longer.
reviews.title: Absolutely the best place on our US/Canada trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location - spectacular scenery, the beautiful river running at the back of the motel. Lovely.
reviews.title: A gem in Lincoln

reviews.text: Rooms - we stayed in a cottage (4 adults). It's basic and clean and comfortable. Everything you'd expect. Great value for all of us.
reviews.title: Another big thumbs up for Mt. Coolidge Motel

reviews.text: I chose this motel based on the fantastic reviews on tripadvisor and I couldn't be happier with my decision. We were traveling from Northern Outdoors in Maine (approx 5 hours) so we called ahead and told the owners we would have a late arrival. They called to check on us on our drive and came out to greet us upon arrival. Kevin was friendly and helpful. We stayed in a cottage which was cute and clean and overlooked a babbling brook. The whole town was adorable. If i get up that way again, I would definitely spend more time in Lincoln and stay at Mt. Coolidge again.
reviews.title: Cute, clean and friendly
great home base
reviews.text: Other reviewers have extolled the virtues of this motel which is why we chose it. We found it clean and well maintained. The owners were friendly. The pool was indeed heated and the kids had fun on a breezy 70 degree day. You cant beat the price. We would happily return.

I echo all of the previous positive reviews. If you are looking for a family-owned and operated motel situated in an accessible area of the White Mountains, look no further. We have a plan to take our two daughters to all fifty states by the time they turn 18 years old, and New Hampshire still needed to be checked off that list. Since hubby had his annual fishing trip with his father, I decided to escape the Texas heat and fly to Manchester, NH to visit the White Mountains. Accompanying me on this trip were our two daughters: ages 5 (and a half!) and also one who just turned two a week ago. This was the first "girl's trip" for us, and it was quite a ways from home! (Especially for a momma traveling by herself with two young daughters!!)
reviews.title: Mom/Daughters Trip on a shoestring budget -- EXCELLENT!

reviews.text: Being a little skeptical of taking this trip alone, I researched it well here on Trip Advisor. For any other moms looking to do this on your own, YES, this is THE place to go. Kevin and Vickie are perfect hosts, and kept an extra eye on us. I also gave Kevin two emergency contact numbers as well that he recorded on our check-in information. I know he was keeping an extra eye out for us, which I thoroughly appreciated. While I am a seasoned traveler, I am also NOT a fan of lodgings with exterior doors --- I am usually an "interior corridor" type of girl! Two months ago we were at Grande Bay Resort in St John! But let me just say my fears were immediately calmed. Yes, I still kept the windows closed at night just to be on the safe side, whereas several rooms kept theirs cracked, but that's just the momma in me.
reviews.title: I will book my vacation around their availability!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We appreciated the in-room fridge, CLEANLINESS (I had to touch one window to see if it was actually a window there!), morning coffee and hot tea in the office, assigned parking right outside our room, community microwave by the ice machine, heated swimming pool (yes, we swam!), picnics at the table by the river, the Moose sighting :) and genuine friendliness of Kevin and Vickie. Since I was traveling alone with the kiddos, I abstained from purchasing a bottle of wine, but had hubby been with us, we would have been enjoying a nightly beverage by the river or in the grassy area out front. There was also a heat wave, and the A/C was great, but the cool river was even better! My two daughters also loved that the tub, sink and toilet were pink. :)
reviews.title: White Mountain Majesty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Old motel and cabins bring back memories of 1960's. Great location, friendly, reasonble price, clean. Only complaint was no coffee in room and office was not open as early as we get up, and I would not expect them to.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Great place to stay if you are visiting White Mountains. Hosts are very friendly, rooms are clean and spacious and the prices are great!
reviews.title: Great place - We loved it!

reviews.text: I chose the Mt. Coolidge Motel based upon the information that I saw here at TripAdvisor, and I definitely agree with the great reviews. Owners Kevin & Vicki Riley were wonderful. I asked for their advice on the best places to eat, grocery shop, and gas up the car during my six-day stay. After a long day of hiking, I enjoyed lounging in a chair on the beautiful, shady front lawn and reading their collection of menus from the local restaurants. The riverside location is lovely. Facing the stream, both my main room's rear window and the bathroom window let in natural light, fresh air, and the sound of the river. There were several lamps so that the room was cheerful at night instead of being dimly lit like many motel rooms. Due to my allergies, my primary concern when selecting a place to stay is that it should be truly smoke-free. I had no problems since the room was clean and fresh. The location of the motel near the Franconia Notch State Park is very convenient for reaching trailheads, and the refrigerator in the room made it easy to pack lunches for hiking. The room rates are also very reasonable for the area.
reviews.title: Great base for hikers

reviews.text: My husband and I had the most wonderful 3 day stay at this VERY clean motel!!! Kevin & Vicki, you are such nice people!!! Thank-you for a great anniversary surprise from our daughter and the two of you too!!!!!!!!!! You went above the call of being wonderful hosts!! We return home with great memories of this trip, and our stay here at this beautiful motel and it's owners. Can not wait to return!!! Thank-you!!
reviews.title: Simply the best!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights here, following the recommendation from Tripadvisor. The location is great and easy to find, right off the highway. It is an easy on to the trailheads, and you can walk to a breakfast place. To get to Lincoln to the other restaurants, or the Kanc, is a short drive. For our hiking trip, the room was clean and worked well for us. Most of all, the owners are really great people, who obviously work very hard to make sure your stay is pleasant. We didn't get a chance to spend any time out by the river due to our schedule, but it would be a very pleasant place to sit by a bonfire. We got a bit of "tapping" noise from what I presume was the heating during the night, but it was really quiet otherwise the nights we were there. I would certainly recommend staying here if you need a place to stay.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, and wonderful owners.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a mini vacation in New Hampshire. Decided to stay at Mt. Coolidge Motel based on the listing of the best bargain motels on Trip Advisor.
reviews.title: Very clean motel
Already planning a return visit
reviews.text: The owners were very friendly. The motel room was extremely clean but the furniture is dated. I definitely prefer having a clean room over updated furniture any day.
The cleaning person forgot to make up our room one day during our stay and the next day she did make the bed but forgot to leave towels. We just went to the front office and requested towels.
reviews.title: The best motel in NH

reviews.text: The hotel offered free Wi-Fi also. I did get knocked off the connection a few times but I just signed back on.
reviews.title: Service with a smile

reviews.text: We enjoyed the pool (I don't think they needed to turn the heater on since it was in the 90s while we were there). Not too many restaurants around the hotel. Hotel is located on the same street as Clark's Trading Post and the entrance for the Flume Gorge making it a great location.
reviews.title: Great value and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at this motel. The place is really easy to find and we were pleasantly surprised by the beautiful stream and the chairs out in the back. The room was quite basic and we felt the carpet could use some cleaning, but overall it was comfortable. We paid $100 for a queen room and I thought that was reasonable relative to other hotels in the neighborhood. Short drive to some very nice trails and to the Kanc highway.
reviews.title: Convenient Location, Comfortable Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I made a fall trip to New Hampshire to see the Fall leaves and to go to the outlet malls. Since this was a last minute trip, I decided to consult Trip Advisor and found the Mount Coolidge Motel. I could not believe all the good reviews on Trip Advisor, so I decided I had to try this motel for myself.
reviews.title: Trip to New Hamphire

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me tell you the reviews are true. This motel is trully an excellent place to stay. Number 1, mount Coolidge is extremely clean and is owned by good folks who do what they can to make your stay enjoyable. The rooms are large and are in very good condition. Some people might say the rooms are dated but in my opinion while not ultra modern, the rooms are more than acceptable and are in keeping with a very well run family establishment. The small river in the back of the motel is beautiful and is a bonus. The Motel is located in Lincoln, MH which is at the western end of the Kancamagus trail so it is a great starting off point to view the fall foilage, or explore the White Mountains Region or to go hiking at locations along the Kancamagus trial. If you want to go shopping, you can take a nice drive down I93 (about 40 minutes) to Tilton NH Outlet Malls or drive along the Kancanagus Hiway to the North Conway Outlet Malls which is about 45-50 minutes from Lincoln. We went one way one day the and on the second day we went to North Conway for the day. Both are very lovely drives. Please note there is also lots to do around LIncoln NH also.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!

reviews.text: To sum up, if you want a great little motel, Mount Coolidge is well run, very clean, and to boot are run by real nice people. The motel is a great value. This is not a cookie cutter chain Hotel but a family run establishment motel that delivers a good service. I will be back and recommend this motel to anybody who wants and nice comfortable place to stay.
reviews.title: Spotless, cozy & romantic

reviews.text: We (two couples) stayed three nights at the Mt. Coolidge Motel during the second week of October. It is a classic looking motel that is exceptionally well maintained, spotlessly clean and in an excellent location. The owners and staff were some of the nicest people we have met in all our travels. The owners were very helpful with directions and suggestions for interesting local activities....and they were lots of fun to talk with. The pool (closed for the season) is a good size and kids will enjoy it. There is also a place for grilling or making a small bonfire next to the stream running behind the motel. While we visited in October, we would also stay here during a summer trip, especially with kids.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received a very warm welcome from the Riley family when we arrived at Mt. Coolidge. They were very accommodating, chatty and friendly - which was much needed after such a long drive up from Boston! They even helped us to find a local restaurant, which was superb.
reviews.title: Very Clean! Great Service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The surroundings are beautiful, right in the middle of the beautiful mountains, it was very scenic. We had a great view of the river from our room.
reviews.title: Spotless!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was very clean, spotless in fact - which is something that is very important to me.
reviews.title: Blessed Canadians

reviews.text: Overall I would highly recommend this motel, it's very resonably priced, located in a beautiful place and we had a lovely stay.
reviews.title: Love it!

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night on a quick getaway to get a last look at the foliage. The room was spacious and immaculate. I do not use the word "immaculate" often to describe hotel rooms, and we have traveled extensively, but this room was absolutely immaculate! I would definitely stay here again. If you are looking for a spotlessly clean, basic room in a convenient, safe area, then this is the place for you!
reviews.title: Perfect spot!

reviews.text: This motel is great - just great! I just returned from a weekend in the White Mountains where we stayed in this charming, historic, river-facing property. Entire hotel property was spotless. Cabin was ample in space and amenities. Any room features that were not present in the cabin (i.e. a coffee-maker or stove) were accommodated by coffee machines in the office, and a microwave around the corner.
reviews.title: Could not be a friendlier, cleaner place with a better location

reviews.text: We were able to stay in one of the original cabins from the property. Even though it is an original structure, it is well maintained and very clean. The owners, Kevin and Vicki, obviously take great pride in their property and love what they are doing - which, frankly, is half the fun of being there.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: The updates that had been done to the cabin were appreciated - baseboard electric heating, with individual thermostats, let people sleep warm/cool, depending on their preference, and, kept the entire cabin comfortable during chilly (May) evenings.
reviews.title: Warm and hospitable staff - Very clean - Well located

reviews.text: We did no planning for this trip whatsoever. Picked a hotel at random, based on these Tripadvisor reviews, and then did no more research at all. And everything turned out perfectly. The location for a tour of the White Mountain region was just perfect, putting you near mom-and-pop dining options, and, putting you at a good spot on the loop. After having driven the loop and seeing all the other touristy towns with their hotels, we were even more convinced of the rightness of this place.
reviews.title: Believe the reviews

reviews.text: Many, many thanks to the Riley's for a wonderful, memorable weekend!
reviews.title: "WOW" Factor

description: The Riley family welcomes you to the Mt. Coolidge Motel at the entrance to Franconia Notch State Park. Located along a scenic mountain stream in the center of New Hampshire's White Mountains. Surrounded by spectacular mountain views, all area attractions are within reach as you relax in the fresh mountain air. We pride ourselves on providing very clean and neat accommodations at affordable rates.
